item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "Don't think or judge, just listen." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "All I'd ever wanted was to forget. but even when I thought I had, pieces had kept emerging, like bits of wood floating up to the surface that only hint at the shipwreck below." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "Because the truth sometimes hurts," I said. Yeah," he said. "So do lies, though." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "He shook his head. "Some people think that they like music,but they have no idea what it's really about. They're kindding themselves. Then there are people who feel strongly about music, but just aren't listening to the right stuff. They're misguided. And then there are people like me." ... "People like you," I said. "What kind of people are those?" ... "The kind who live for music and are constantly seeking it out, anywhere they can. Who can't imagine a life without it. They're enlightened." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "Life isn't fair," Owen told her. "Get used to it." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "Spiritually evolved people, by virtue of their discipline, mastery and love, are people of extraordinary competence, and in their competence they are called on to serve the world, and in their love they answer the call." -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "Love is the will to extend one's self for the purpose of nurturing one's own or another's spiritual growth... Love is as love does. Love is an act of will -- namely, both an intention and an action. Will also implies choice. We do not have to love. We choose to love." -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "The truth is that our finest moments are most likely to occur when we are feeling deeply uncomfortable, unhappy, or unfulfilled. For it is only in such moments, propelled by our discomfort, that we are likely to step out of our ruts and start searching for different ways or truer answers." -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "We must be willing to fail and to appreciate the truth that often "Life is not a problem to be solved, but a mystery to be lived." -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and theyâ€™ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back." -- John Green

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by pleasefindthis
item.description: "I have pretended to go mad in order to tell you the things I need to. I call it art. Because art is the word we give to our feelings made public. And art doesn't worry anyone." -- pleasefindthis

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by pleasefindthis
item.description: "I would find you down the line with broken wings, pick you up, and swear that you would taste the sky again." -- pleasefindthis

item.title: Gail Monique add a quote by pleasefindthis
item.description: "You are the best parts of all the songs I love." -- pleasefindthis
